CONCLUSION: Violation of Article 6 - Right to a fair trial (Article 6 - Civil proceedings;Article 6-1 - Reasonable time)
JUDGES: Jon Fridrik Kjølbro;Ledi Bianku;Nebojša Vučinić;Paul Lemmens;Georges Ravarani
TEXT: CARDINAL . The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant brought a compensation claim for damages suffered as a consequence of an expropriation of his property against GPE and CARDINAL of the local primary schools before ORG ( PERSON ) in GPE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant ’s representative informed ORG that he had initiated a separate set of proceedings to determine the value of the above - mentioned damages . ORG suspended the above mentioned civil proceedings pending the final resolution of this matter .

CARDINAL . No document was submitted by the parties as to whether or not the compensation proceedings have ended in the meantime . Accordingly , it would appear that the said CARDINAL sets of proceedings are still pending before ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant instituted proceedings before ORG in Bar , against his neighbour , seeking a demarcation between their CARDINAL plots of land .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant amended his proposal to this effect .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant and the respondent reached a friendly settlement which was approved by ORG on DATE .
